wpt.name: GC1XBG1
wpt.desc: Bonds' Factory by lindwood, Traditional Cache (1.5/1)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Bonds' Factory
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description: This was known as Bonds' factory as early as 1847. The mill operated for 110 years, along Beaver Creek, making everything from woolens in 1841 to linings for U.S. Air Force jackets during WW11. At some point clusters of houses were built and named Bondsville,after the mill owner. It closed permanently in 1954. Since then the buildings have fallen victim to the weather. A memorial was erected to commemerate the factory workers who served in WW11. Be sure to look through the gate to see the mill. Film cannister with log,pencil and a few tree+-deer confetti. Congratulations to bpp_picnic for FTF !!
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: 10 ft to the right of corporation then 2ft to the back of corporation and up

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Took a few minutes to make the find, then my daughter read the memorial and we talked about it for a minute. TFTC! Found with dawnie22 and 19acassel.
